knimeNode.name: Create Temp Dir
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a temporary directory upon execute and exposes its path as flow variable.

fullDescription.intro: Creates a temporary directory upon execute and exposes its path as flow variable. This can be useful in (a) demo application where the actual path of the output is not all that relevant, e.g. the KNIME public workflow server and (b) KNIME web portals and quick form flows, where some data is written, which is later downloaded by means of, e.g. a web link.
fullDescription.option: Name prefix of the temporary direction. It will be amended by some random number to ensure uniqueness.
The name of the exported variable denoting the actual path.
Check this box to delete the directory and all its content when the node is reset or the workflow is closed.

A list of additional variables that will be created by the node. Each variable will denote a path to a file (as opposed to a directory path), whereby the file name is given in the second (file name) column
